_header: Kneeling alone right thus I make my will
Subjects: complaints; testaments; lovers, faithful; lovers, death of
_description: A Compleynt, a testament bequeathing the lover’s heart and will — three stanzas rhyme royal

BodFair16.First Lines:
Knelyng allon ryght thus I may make my wylleAs your seruaunt in
                    euery maner wyse…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…I can no more but alle my faythfull trystIt lythe in yow
                    demene me as ye lyst
BodFair16.Facsimiles:
Norton-Smith,  John. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Bodleian Library MS Fairfax 16.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.
